SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Interface Vector

All Superinterfaces:
Number
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericVector, Quaternion, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4
public interface Vector extends Number

Vector

An array of scalars. A vector is composed of two or more scalars, and can represent a direction and/or magnitude, or a certain coordinate within an n-dimensional space.

  • Method Details

    • toArray

      @Nonnull double[] toArray()
      Converts the vector to an array representation.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface Number
      Returns:
      An array containing the components of the vector.

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of components in this vector.
      Returns:
      The number of components in the vector.

    • magnitude

      double magnitude()
      Calculates and returns the magnitude (length) of this vector.
      Returns:
      The magnitude of the vector.

    • magnitude2

      double magnitude2()
      Calculates and returns the squared magnitude of this vector. The squared magnitude is often used for optimization purposes as it avoids the square root operation.
      Returns:
      The squared magnitude of the vector.

    • add

      @Nonnull Vector add(double s)
      Adds a scalar value to each component of the vector.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar value to be added.
      Returns:
      A new vector resulting from the addition.

    • subtract

      @Nonnull Vector subtract(double s)
      Subtracts a scalar value from each component of the vector.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar value to be subtracted.
      Returns:
      A new vector resulting from the subtraction.

    • multiply

      @Nonnull Vector multiply(double s)
      Multiplies each component of the vector by a scalar value.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar value to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      A new vector resulting from the multiplication.

    • divide

      @Nonnull Vector divide(double s)
      Divides each component of the vector by a scalar value.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar value to be divided by.
      Returns:
      A new vector resulting from the division.

    • apply

      @Nonnull Vector apply(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> operator)
      Applies the given unary operator to each component of the vector and returns a new vector with the resulting values.
      Parameters:
      operator - The unary operator to apply to each component.
      Returns:
      A new vector with the components transformed by the given operator.

    • negate

      @Nonnull Vector negate()
      Returns the negation of this vector. The negation of a vector is a vector with the same magnitude but opposite direction.
      Returns:
      The negation of the vector.

    • normalize

      @Nonnull Vector normalize()
      Returns a normalized vector. If the magnitude is 0, this will return a vector with no direction or magnitude. (a vector where all component values are zero)
      Returns:
      A normalized vector.

    • createVector

      @Nonnull static Vector createVector(@Nonnull double[] values)
      Creates a vector from a double array.
      Parameters:
      values - The array of values for the vector.
      Returns:
      A new vector instance based on the length of the input array.

    • parseVector

      @Nonnull static Vector parseVector(@Nonnull String input)
      Parses a string representation of a vector and returns a Vector instance.
      Parameters:
      input - The string representation of the vector.
      Returns:
      A Vector instance representing the parsed vector.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If the input string is not a valid vector format.
